TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national born in DATE and currently living in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr Gazi Ziauddin , GPE . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant left GPE on DATE and came to GPE where he applied for political asylum . He claimed that he used to be a member of ORG ( hereinafter “ the party ” ) , an opposition left - wing party . He further claimed that , due to his political involvement , he had been arrested and jailed in DATE and subjected to repeated torture . He had been released after DATE . On DATE the Dhaka Judge Court had sentenced him to life imprisonment with hard labour for illegal possession of arms . However , the verdict had allegedly been an attempt to put an end to his political activity .

His application was rejected by ORG ) on DATE and by ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) on DATE , which concluded that the applicant would have the opportunity to receive a fair trial upon return to GPE , and that political activity did not , as such , entail persecution by the authorities in GPE . The applicant was sent back to GPE in DATE .

The applicant returned to GPE on DATE , again applying for asylum . He claimed that , upon arrival in GPE in DATE , he had been arrested by the military and brought to a police station where he had been questioned . Before the questioning , a member of the military had made the secret sign of the Sharbahara party . During the questioning , the soldiers had said that they had been looking for him and that they wanted to know whether he was PERSON , member of the PERSON party . He was then tortured badly and transferred to a prison from which he had escaped in DATE , with the help of a party friend . In spite of the torture he had not revealed his identity , which was , the applicant claimed , probably why the sentence of life imprisonment had not been executed . After having escaped , he had lived in hiding for DATE but had continued to work for the party .

The applicant further stated that he had been arrested at a party conference in GPE in DATE , after which he had been jailed and repeatedly tortured . After CARDINAL months’ imprisonment a party friend had helped him escape . Following his escape he had found out that he had been charged with the murder of another prisoner .

He had again lived in hiding , but had continued to work for the party . He had distributed leaflets and had been able to work quite freely . However , during a demonstration in DATE , he had been arrested and tortured anew . CARDINAL party members had been killed during the demonstration and he had been accused of the killings . Proceedings had been instituted against him in PERSON . He believed that he had escaped sometime in DATE or DATE . This time too , he had received help from a party member . He had subsequently found out that a court in GPE had sentenced him to death in absentia on DATE for the murder of his cell - mate of which he had been accused in DATE .

In a letter to ORG in DATE the applicant submitted that after his escape in DATE his political party had helped him to contact ‘ ORG , a nursing home in GPE where he had been treated DATE for his torture injuries . After his escape in DATE , he had returned to ORG and had been treated there DATE between DATE and DATE . Following his escape in DATE , he had received treatment in a nursing home in GPE .

The party had helped him leave GPE . He submitted before ORG that he risked being killed by his own party , because members who had been jailed were regarded as a security risk since they could reveal secret information concerning the party . His life was also threatened by NORP fundamentalists since he was a NORP . He had once been taken captive by such people and was to be killed . He had , however , managed to scare off his captors . Besides the death sentences against him , the Government had ordered the police to shoot members of the PERSON party .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for asylum . It made the following observations : The applicant had travelled to GPE with a false passport and had not applied for asylum until this had been discovered . He had also submitted unclear information regarding the details of his journey and had thus tried to hide information relevant to the investigation . Considering his submissions that he had on numerous occasions been arrested and tortured , that a life sentence had not been executed because the authorities had not been able to identify him , that he had in the meantime continued to work for the party , that he was persecuted by NORP fundamentalists , and that he risked being executed by his party despite having been continuously helped by the party to escape and in the end to leave the country , ORG concluded that the applicant was not credible . It also remarked that he had not been able to submit any documentation regarding his allegations .

Upon appeal , ORG , by a decision of DATE , granted the applicant a permanent residence permit . It reiterated that the applicant had been committed under LAW DATE , having been suicidal and diagnosed with potential post - traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) , which had however not been confirmed . The applicant had also submitted a medical certificate concluding that it was probable that he had been subjected to torture as alleged . ORG deferred to the conclusions of ORG with regard to his credibility . However , due to his medical condition , the applicant was entitled to stay in GPE .

The applicant ’s wife joined him in GPE in DATE together with their daughter PERSON , born in DATE . PERSON is physically handicapped and dumb . The applicant also has a DATE son in GPE with whom he has no contact . On DATE the applicant was charged with aggravated assault against a woman ( grov kvinnofridskränkning ) , it being alleged , inter alia , that on several occasions he had beaten his wife when she had refused to have sex with other men who had promised the applicant money , and had otherwise systematically abused her . The applicant had replied that , due to the torture he had become impotent and for this reason his wife had met another man . It was the applicant ’s understanding that they had conspired to put him in jail .

On DATE ORG ( tingsrätten ) of GPE convicted the applicant as charged . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment and subsequent expulsion from GPE , being forbidden to return before DATE , in accordance with LAW , section CARDINAL of LAW , in conjunction with the relevant provisions of LAW .

Subsequent to the applicant ’s conviction , divorce proceedings between the applicant and his wife had been initiated at ORG . The same court had also awarded the applicant ’s former wife custody of their daughter . The applicant had appealed this latter decision .

Concerning the issue of the applicant ’s expulsion , ORG ( Migrationsverket ) submitted to ORG that there was no obstacle to expelling the applicant to GPE . The court did not make any separate assessment in this respect , but deferred to the conclusion of ORG . It further noted that , ever since the applicant had been granted a permanent residence permit in GPE , he had received a social security allowance and had been on sick - leave due to psychiatric problems until DATE . It therefore questioned to what extent he had acquired a real connection to NORP society . Moreover , the violence of which he had been convicted had been aimed at CARDINAL of his CARDINAL family members , his only relatives in GPE . The court held that , considering the nature of the violence and the applicant ’s ruthlessness , it could not be excluded that he would again commit a crime in GPE . Having regard to his weak links with GPE , as well as to the fact that he had had a residence permit for DATE , the ORG held that he could be expelled .

Both the prosecutor and the applicant appealed against the sentence , and the applicant also appealed against the expulsion order . On DATE ORG ( PERSON hovrätt ) raised the sentence to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , but otherwise confirmed the verdict and agreed with the assessment of ORG . On DATE ORG ( Högsta Domstolen ) refused the applicant leave to appeal .

The applicant ’s expulsion was to be enforced on DATE . On DATE the police authority decided that he should be taken into custody upon his release from prison on DATE , to await the execution of his expulsion order .

On DATE the applicant submitted a petition to ORG , asking that the ORG stay or quash the planned expulsion . No information has been submitted as to the outcome . In support of the petition , the application claimed that proceedings had been initiated against him in GPE for the alleged killing of a Mr PERSON which had supposedly taken place in DATE . A group of investigators had found the applicant guilty of the killing . On CARDINAL and DATE a court had issued an arrest warrant for the applicant , referring to a provision in the NORP penal code under which the penalty , according to the applicant , was death or life imprisonment .

The applicant has submitted copies of NORP documents and translations thereof . CARDINAL of the documents is a “ charge sheet ” , dated DATE , according to which the injured party is the widow of the above - mentioned Mr PERSON . The applicant is mentioned as the “ hidden guilty person ” , apparently registered in an area called LOC within the district of GPE . It follows from the document , without further clarification , that a “ preliminary report ” had been issued on CARDINAL DATE . The charge sheet refers to the applicant as CARDINAL of the CARDINAL perpetrators of the alleged crime , the effect of which appears to have been the death of Mr PERSON . It states that a body was found covered in blood and that all the evidence was sent to the court . The second document is a ORG ’s “ court order ” , dated CARDINAL and DATE . It refers to a provision in GPE Code under which , according to the applicant , the penalty is death or life imprisonment . The document states that , on DATE , the investigation group found the applicant , who was in hiding , to be guilty as charged . Upon the request of the prosecutor , a warrant for his arrest was issued . The document states at the end “ Accused has been accepted ” . The copies of the NORP documents are accompanied by a statement from a Mr PERSON , senior advocate in the GPE and ORG . The letter in LANGUAGE is dated DATE , addressed to the applicant and reads , inter alia , as follows :

“ The punishment of the case might be either death sentence or life imprisonment and the facts of your absconding from the prosecution will contribute and confirm such depth of punishment . I understand quite well that a great unavoidable circumstances like torture and persecution which has been used for you in jail and the possibility of killing by the members of your [ Sharbahara party ] compelled you to leave the country but the nature of the case is ignoring such facts of circumstances . By the fact in issue , you are the master mind and the authority of the event and the possibility of escaping is less as the procedural materials developed in the case . ”

The applicant has also submitted transcripts from his medical journal and some medical certificates . In a transcript dated DATE from ORG för tortyrskadade ) at ORG ( “ FAC ) , the doctor concluded that the applicant had many scars and other marks on his body which could very well be the result of certain of the alleged acts of torture . A new transcript from his medical journal at FAC is dated DATE and states that , after his visit in DATE , the applicant submitted that he had been beaten , subjected to electric shocks , burned with cigarettes , drenched with hot water , suffocated , had needles put under his fingernails and his fingernails pulled out , and subjected to strong light and high volume noise . In a certificate dated DATE , also from the Centre , Dr PERSON , specialist in forensic medicine , noted that the applicant had acquired new injuries , many of which were consistent with scarring from cigarette burns . It could not be excluded that some of the marks had been contracted due to disease , but it was less probable that the scars would have arisen due to accidents or that they had been self - inflicted . He concluded that it was probable that the applicant had been tortured or beaten as alleged , and that many of the torture methods mentioned would only occasionally leave any lasting marks . The torture described was furthermore to a great extent compatible with the ORG ’s previous experience of torture in GPE .

In a certificate from the ORG dated DATE , Dr PERSON , chief physician and specialist in general psychiatry , noted that the applicant had urgent thoughts of suicide and was completely absorbed by the memories of traumatic experiences . He had severe sleeping problems and difficulties to eat . His speech was partly incoherent but he described electric torture in a manner indicating that he had experienced it .
